Select Hyperparameters

Source: R/tune-tk_tune_parameters.R
tk_parameter_select_by_row.Rd

tk_parameter_select_by_row() provides a wrapper to tune::select_best() that makes it easy to select the n-th model.

tk_parameter_select_by_row(.data, .n = 1)

Arguments

.data

A tibble of class "tune_results"
.n

Row to select from the model ranking

Value

A tibble or data.frame with parameter values.

Examples

library(dplyr)
library(tune)
library(timetk)

# Output of tune::tune_grid()
arima_workflow_tuned
#> # Time Series Cross Validation Plan 
#> # A tibble: 2 x 4
#>   splits          id     .metrics           .notes          
#>   <list>          <chr>  <list>             <list>          
#> 1 <split [72/24]> Slice1 <tibble [294 × 9]> <tibble [1 × 1]>
#> 2 <split [72/24]> Slice2 <tibble [288 × 9]> <tibble [2 × 1]>

# PARAMETER RANKING ----
arima_workflow_tuned %>%
    tk_parameter_ranking(.max_failure_rate = 1)
#> Using .metric = 'mae'
#> # A tibble: 50 x 15
#>        p     d     q     P     D     Q .metric .estimator  mean     n std_err
#>    <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl>
#>  1     3     1     2     2     0     2 mae     standard    142.     1   NA   
#>  2     2     1     1     2     0     2 mae     standard    142.     1   NA   
#>  3     4     1     4     1     0     1 mae     standard    183.     2  108.  
#>  4     2     1     1     1     0     1 mae     standard    190.     2  117.  
#>  5     2     1     2     1     0     1 mae     standard    190.     2  117.  
#>  6     2     0     3     0     1     0 mae     standard    203.     2   43.5 
#>  7     1     0     4     1     0     0 mae     standard    207.     2    3.09
#>  8     3     0     1     1     0     0 mae     standard    214.     2    1.50
#>  9     3     0     4     1     0     1 mae     standard    224.     2   40.5 
#> 10     3     1     5     1     0     2 mae     standard    225.     2  151.  
#> # … with 40 more rows, and 4 more variables: failure_rate <dbl>,
#> #   .rank_metric <int>, .rank_failure_rate <int>, .rank_std_err <int>

# PARAMETER SELECTION ----
arima_workflow_tuned %>%
    tk_parameter_ranking(.max_failure_rate = 1) %>%
    tk_parameter_select_by_row(.n = 3)
#> Using .metric = 'mae'
#> # A tibble: 1 x 6
#>       p     d     q     P     D     Q
#>   <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
#> 1     4     1     4     1     0     1
